titleStmt.title: A warning for all lewd livers: by the example of a disobedient child, who rioutously wasted and consumed his father and mother's goods, and also his own, amongst vile strumpet[s], and other lewd livers, and died most miserably on a dunghil. To the tune of, Sir Andrew Barton, &c.
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by and for W[illiam]. O[nley]. for A[lexander]. M[ilbourn]. and sold by J[onah]. Deacon, at the angel in Guil-spur-street [sic].,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "My bleeding heart with grief and care ..."
Author, date of publication and publishers' names from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
